channel.title: Crisscross
channel.description: Musings on what I do, what I make, and where I go. I take nothing for granted and try to give everything its due space for reflection.

item.title: If I have to say hello to strangers, this is what I'd say.
item.description:
"They" told me I should market myself with a brand, so I guess this blog is me attempting that.

I don't think a lengthy introduction is necessary, but I feel like have to write something of the sort. You'll all get to know me pretty well as I write.

To
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Ogbuehi
item.content:encoded:
"They" told me I should market myself with a brand, so I guess this blog is me attempting that.

I don't think a lengthy introduction is necessary, but I feel like have to write something of the sort. You'll all get to know me pretty well as I write.

To start, my name is Vanessa, but if you want to call me Nessa or something, I'd accept that too. I've never had a nickname.

I like to call myself a "creative professional". I'm aware of how cheesy that sounds, and I know that title lacks some legitimacy, but as this point of my career, it's the most flexible and it's appropriately descriptive.

I make things. I'm a professional costumer, theatre artist, and now web developer. Really, I'm kind of a junky when it comes to art. I'll pick up any medium as long as it serves my purposes. I still haven't found that one thing that makes me go "yes, this is my life's purpose", but I'm still young, and perhaps one of the aforementioned crafts will stick longer than the others.

Regardless, I have a unique background, and that helps in everything I do.

Hmm. What else about me is pertinent?

I'm a vegan. I like controversy. I think MS Publisher is of the devil. I think Philadelphia is the best city in the world, but the suburbs of Yokohama, Japan are pretty nice too.

It's nice to meet you.
